summary: TPM Line Monitor: a simple role-based web app for steel processing plants to track TPM across multiple production lines (machine health/status, downtime reasons, maintenance activities, operator autonomous maintenance, compliance, and basic OEE dashboard/reporting) to reduce breakdowns and improve availability.
architectural_notes: Web app usable on mobile, tablet, and desktop (no installation).
Cloud database storage with automatic backups.
Role-based access control tied to user roles (Admin/Supervisor/Operator/Maintenance).
Shop-floor UX: large buttons, minimal typing (dropdowns/checkboxes), fast operator flow (<30s).

existing_features.title: Create a complete MVP UI wireframe (page structure + component layout) for the TPM Line Monitor web app, covering the full navigation and all key screens for each role (Operator, Supervisor, Maintenance Technician, Admin).

Design and implement the Authentication + Role Landing wireframes: Login screen (username + password), and post-login landing that routes users to the correct role home (Operator, Supervisor, Maintenance Technician, Admin).

Design and implement the Operator wireframes for the <30-second flow: Machine/Line selection, Machine status update (Running/Idle/Breakdown), Start/Stop time capture, Downtime reason dropdown when in Breakdown, and an automatic downtime duration display/calculation area.

Design and implement the Autonomous Maintenance (Operator TPM) wireframes: a checklist for cleaning/lubrication/inspection, completion marking, optional photo upload UI, and a simple completion confirmation state.

Design and implement the Supervisor wireframes: Dashboard overview (machines running vs stopped, OEE summary, today’s breakdown count, pending maintenance tasks, TPM compliance %) using simple green/yellow/red indicators; screens to verify/approve operator TPM activities, view missed activities, and access report downloads.

Design and implement the Maintenance Technician and Admin wireframes: Maintenance Technician screens for breakdown jobs (list, detail, update progress, close job with repair time + root cause); Admin screens for managing machines and users, and for setting planned maintenance schedules (daily/weekly/monthly).

Apply a cohesive, distinct industrial visual theme across the wireframe UI (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) suitable for steel processing plants and shop-floor readability; avoid blue/purple as the primary palette.

Replace all hardcoded default machine names in the UI with the following machine names: "HR CTL 800", "NWCTL", "Stretch Leveller", "HR Slitting" (removing the current generic names like "Rolling Mill #1", etc.), and ensure the updated names are reflected consistently anywhere a machine list or machine label is displayed.

Revise the Operator TPM check sheet UI to use a simplified layout while expanding the checklist with additional checklist points, and add a per-check optional remark input so the operator can write a remark against each checklist item.
Update the Supervisor TPM Approval Detail screen to display the revised checklist content and include any per-check remarks in the checklist review presentation (read-only for supervisors).

Provide a frontend flow for the currently signed-in user to become Admin, calling the new backend promotion API and then switching the app role to `admin` so admin navigation and admin pages become accessible.

new_feature_requests.summary: Role-based login and user management (Admin, Supervisor, Operator, Maintenance technician) with screen access restrictions
Dashboard overview showing machines running vs stopped, OEE summary, today’s breakdown count, pending maintenance tasks, and TPM compliance % with green/yellow/red indicators
Machine status tracking per line (Running/Idle/Breakdown), start/stop time recording, downtime reason dropdown, and automatic downtime duration calculation

Maintenance management: planned maintenance scheduling (daily/weekly/monthly), reminders/alerts, completion marking with remarks; breakdown maintenance logging, technician assignment, repair time and root cause capture
Autonomous maintenance (operator TPM) checklist: operators record cleaning/lubrication/inspection, optional photo upload, mark completion; supervisors verify and view missed activities
Reports & analytics with downloads: daily machine downtime report, weekly TPM compliance, top 10 breakdown reasons, MTBF/MTTR trends, line-wise OEE; export to Excel/PDF
MVP UI wireframe/screen layouts for operator, supervisor, maintenance, and admin flows optimized for quick shop-floor use (large buttons, minimal typing)
Update default machine/line names to: HR CTL 800, NWCTL, Stretch Leveller, HR Slitting (replace generic machine names)
Revise TPM check sheet: simplify layout, expand with additional checklist points, and add per-check remarks field/input
Change the requesting user's role/account permissions to Admin (make me admin)

Add a backend API that can promote the current caller (Internet Identity principal) to Admin so that the caller is recognized as an Admin by backend authorization checks and by any existing `getCallerUserRole()` logic.
